name: Spicy Sichuan Kung Pao Chicken with Wonton Noodles
recipeIngredients: 1 lb boneless chicken breast or thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces (450g)
recipeInstructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from the wok and set aside.
In the same wok, add more oil if necessary, then sauté the garlic, onion, peanuts, and Sichuan peppercorn paste until fragrant.
Add the soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch mixture; stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Return the chicken to the wok and stir in the sesame oil. Cook for an additional minute.
Cook the wonton noodles according to package instructions. Serve the Kung Pao chicken on top of the noodles, garnished with chopped scallions.
description: A spicy and savory Sichuan dish that combines chicken, peanuts, garlic, and chili peppers in a bold sauce, served atop crispy wonton noodles.
image: A photo of the finished dish, with the Kung Pao chicken on top of a bed of steaming hot wonton noodles, garnished with chopped scallions.
